item.title: How to write Badass READMES for your Github projects
item.description: You show your GitHub project to people but they don’t understand it. Why write docs if they can simply “read the code”? The problem with this approach is that it adds more friction to the reader. How did you feel last time someone did that to you? What about making them feel on-boarded and impressed with your README instead? It saves time, it shows you care about good communication and that by writing good docs you probably write good code as well.
